intro: Cochlearia szovitzii, commonly known as the Szovitz's cochlearia, is a flowering plant species native to the alpine regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it produces small, round pods that contain the seeds. Cochlearia szovitzii is often found in mountainous areas of Austria, Germany, and the Czech Republic.
